title.narrative: Improving livelihoods of rural people through livestock development in the community of Starosillia, Sarata raion, Odesa oblast

description.narrative: This project will support 390 poor rural families in Starosillia village, Sarata raion, Odesa oblast in Southern Ukraine. Within the project, 40 families will receive 120 pregnant ewes and 2 rams of Tsigeian sheep breed. An additional 80 families will receive pass-ons in two POG cycles. Moreover, at least 135 families will receive training packages and services from a milk collection truck, laboratory, mower and access to ASC pasture. The pass on of equipment provided by the ASC to its new members will increase the number of people served by at least 135 beneficiaries. The cooperative will provide land for pasture, seeds of perennial grasses, fertilizers, tractor, seeder and grass mower to supply sheep with feeds. This equipment will also be used to provide services to ASC members (project participants). Sheep will provide milk, of which brynza (salted cheese) and ryazhenka (sour baked milk) will be produced; wool after cleansing and combing out will be used for producing wool yarn and warm blankets. By 2014, project participants will increase their incomes by at least 25 percent from selling surplus salted cheese, mutton and wool, and through the use of services and trainings. The project will have a significant impact on the community in general, raise the income of project participants by providing new employment opportunities, improve nutrition and quality of local herd and give new knowledge on breeding livestock and sustainable development.
